news politics tory-mp-becomes-first-announce-"Boris Johnson backs MP Jamie Wallis after trans announcementByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar An MP today became the first in British history to announce they are trans, saying: I have never lived my truth and I’m not sure how. Jamie Wallis, the Tory MP for Bridgend in south Wales since , shared the news in a statement in the early hours today. The statement on Dr Wallisapos website said: I’m trans. Or to be more accurate, I want to be. I’ve been diagnosed with gender dysphoria and I’ve felt this way since I was a very young child. I had no intention of ever sharing this with you. I always imagined I would leave politics well before I ever said this out loud. The MP went on: Being an MP and hiding something like this was always going to be tough, but I arrogantly assumed I was up for it. Well, I’m not. Dr Wallis was praised by campaigners and MP colleagues. Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who last night made a joke about trans issues in a speech to MPs, said at PMQs: The House stands with you and will give you the support you need to live freely as yourself. Keir Starmer echoed his comments. The PM tweeted: Sharing this very intimate story would have taken an immense amount of courage. Thank you @JamieWallisMP for your bravery, which will undoubtedly support others. The Conservative Party I lead will always give you, and everyone , the love and support you need to be yourself. Minister for Women and Equalities Liz Truss wrote: Well done Jamie Wallis for speaking out and your brave statement. We stand with you. Tory party chairman Oliver Dowden said: Proud of my colleague Jamie Wallis. As a Conservative family we stand together, and we will support you. I hope that your brave statement will help others.Conservative Tom Tugendhat said this is a very brave statement, while Labouraposs Angela Eagle tweeted: This is very brave. Look after yourself and take the time you need to recover. Labour MP Chris Bryant wrote: Dear Jamie I wish you all the very best. Colleagues across the House will respect your openness honesty and the journey you are on. Cwtch.Benjamin Cohen, the chief executive of Pink News, added: This is truly groundbreaking, the UK’s first MP to share that they are trans. The LGBT+ Conservatives group tweeted: Asking for help  seeking comfort in those around you isn’t always easy. The group told the MP it was also in your support network - and are always here to support you whenever you need. You’ve always been there for us, now it’s our turn. In the online post Dr Wallis said they had been a victim of separate crimes of blackmail and rape, after which things have really taken a tumble adding: I am not OK. The MP wrote: There was a close call in April  when someone Blackmailed me, outed me to my father and sent photographs to other family members. He wanted £, to keep quiet. The police were so supportive, so understanding and on this occasion the system worked. He pled guilty and was sentenced to yrs and mnths in prison. After describing an incident of rape, the MP went on: I have not been myself since this incident and I don’t think I will ever recover. It is not something you ever forget, and it is not something you ever move on from. Dr Wallis was arrested on suspicion of driving while unfit after colliding into a lamp post in November. In the overnight web statement, the MP wrote: I fled the scene. I did so because I was terried. I have PTSD and I honestly have no idea what I was doing except I was overcome by an overwhelming sense of fear. I am sorry that it appears I aposran awayapos but this isn’t how it happened in the moment.The MP praised the support of colleagues and Conservative whips, after Boris Johnson hosted a dinner for Tory MPs at a London hotel. According to reports, the Prime Minister opened his speech with a joke saying: Good evening ladies and gentleman, or as Keir Starmer would put it, people who are assigned female or male at birth.However, Dr Wallis wrote: Tonight, I was reminded of the incredible support those you work with can provide. Also, I was reminded how important it is to be yourself. I have never lived my truth and I’m not sure how. Perhaps it starts with telling everyone. Trans rights, and how to describe trans people, have become a topic of bitter debate in Westminster.In , ministers scrapped plans to make it easier for trans people to change their legal gender after campaigners raised concerns about biological sex and the preservation of women-only spaces.Trans people still need a medical diagnosis of gender dysphoria, evidence they have lived in their assumed gender for two years, agreement from their spouse, and to have their bid approved by a  of medics and judges. Human rights groups and LGBT rights group Stonewall condemned the government for falling far short on its promise of reform. Boris Johnson last week said the issue requires extreme sensitivity, tact, love and care. We must recognise that when people want to make a transition in their lives, they should be treated with the maximum possible generosity and respect. We have systems in this country that allow that and have done for a long time, and we should be very proud of that, but I want to say in addition that I think, when it comes to distinguishing between a man and a woman, the basic facts of biology remain overwhelmingly important. Boris Johnson’s Press Secretary twice refused to sayhe regretted his joke about trans people, instead telling journalists: “You’ve heard him direct Jamie directly”. Askedhe stood by his comments on the biology of gender the Press Secretary said: “Yes, you’ve heard him say that before.” Read MoreRead More Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Conservative PartyPolitics" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news absent-prince-harry-meghan-stay-"Queen arrives at Prince Philips memorial with Prince AndrewByChristopher BucktinUnited States Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments The Duke of Sussex, , was the only senior member of the royal family not to attend yesterdayaposs memorial. It was rumoured Prince Harry was at home with his we, Meghan Markle and two children in Montecito, Calornia, where they own an £ million mansion.The service began at .am in the UK - .am at the Princeaposs home. It is unknownhe watched the service, which was broadcast live.Harry did make an appearance during the coverage of the service in a resurfaced clip from the documentary aposA aposUnique Portraitapos of Prince Philip and his leapos.The Duke, who is due to travel to Holland in a fortnight to attend the Invictus Games, refused to travel over a row about his security.  Harry is currently pursuing a legal challenge against the Home Office after being told he would no longer be given the personal protective security he was once afforded as a senior royal when back in the UK.His reasoning to stay away from his grandfatheraposs memorial was branded pathetic by former royal protection officer Richard Grfin, who spent  years guarding the Duke of Edinburgh.He said: Prince Philip was their grandfather, so William has obviously had a great training from him and is going to learn examples from him. I just hope Harry gets some of these things in his mind. aposIt [Harry not being here] was a big disappointment for everybody. People were talking about it. Certainly around where I was, people were saying he should have been here. aposAll this nonsense about how he couldnapost get protection, as far as Iaposm concerned, that was a pathetic excuse. He shouldaposve been here to honour his grandfather. title: bar manager says hes priced
story: Bar manager says hes put up beer prices to get rid of clientele we dont wantThe cheapest price for a pint at Dovecot in Middlesbrough is £. priced to dissuade some people from drinking there - a decision which has aggravated some would-be customersCarl Blake is hoping to avoid lads on a session and instead wants premium drinkers Image: Teesside LiveByEmily CraigieAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A bar has purposefully set its beer prices high to “get rid of clientele” such as lads on a session, in an attempt to entice in “premium drinkers ”. Dovecot, in Middlesbrough, has applied for planning permission to replace disabled car parking spaces nearby with a new summer house. In the meantime owner Carl Blake is looking to extend the beer garden, but is planning to avoid rowdy drinkers using the premises, Teesside Live reported.He said: “We don’t want the social club crowd that wants cheap beer. “Our cheapest pint is £. so we get rid of that type of clientele, we don’t do Carling, we don’t do Fosters. “I don’t want it to come across as it’s going to be a free for all Oktoberfest-style outdoor area because that’s not what we are looking for. “We are expensive, we are premium, everything we do is premium, so we look for that high-end clientele. That’s what we are looking for.  “We would rather have a couple of ladies who have been shopping in the town and stopping in for a bottle of wine rather than a group of lads on a session. “In this area, we have a lot of places where you can go and get sozzled but we don’t have a lot of places where you can go out as a couple and enjoy it.” The plans to avoid some types of drinkers was not appreciated by some people who suggested in the current economic climate businesses can ill afford to pick and choose. One unhappy social media user said: “£. so we get rid of that type of clientele  “Wow! Just wow, grab what you can this day and age pal ‘cause things about to get a lot lot worse.”  Another added: “Disgusting attitude. “This snob deserves to have no customers. I wouldnapost go there even though I could afford to.” Another said: “He says Middlesbrough needs this, then he doesn’t want that clientele. “He does realise Middlesbrough is a working class town and the majority is ‘that clientele’. “I hope he goes bust, the clown.” Mr Blake has also submitted a licensing application to cover the outdoor space and extend the bar’s opening hours on weeknights so that it can hold late-night private s But the owner had been questioning whether he should be ploughing money into the area following a number of recent break-ins. He added: “We have an awful lot of problems at the minute. “It’s dreadful, we have had two break-ins, a car broken into so even though we are spending money on the area, you are still thinking to yourself, am I doing the right thing ” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON BeerAlcoholPubs" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: bride groom best man spend
story: Bride, groom and best man spend wedding night in jail after mass brawl with mumNewlyweds, Claire and Eammon Goodbrand from Uddingston, South Lanarkshire, spent the night in handcuffs and separate cells after the bride attacked her own motherThe trio were released baring their wedding battle wounds and looking red faced Image: Vic RodrickByHollie BoneNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar A newlywed couple spent their first night as a married couple in a wedding cell after their celebrations descended into chaos and a violent brawl broke out. The bride, groom and best man were all arrested after the bride attacked her own mother at the reception in Bathgate, West Lothian, Scotland. The mayhem began when Claire Goodbrand, , violently attacked and injured her mum Cherry-Ann Lindsay, erupting into a large scuffle where the groom and best man weighed in. New husband Eamonn Goodbrand and his brother Kieran, their best man, joined the fracas, viciously assaulting wedding guest David Boyd and leaving him severely injured, a court has heard. The best man also attacked and injured another guest before police arrived to break-up the brawl.Officers took the wedding party trio away in cuffs and were remanded in custody in separate cells before appearing in court, the Daily Record reports.When they were finally released from custody Claire was wearing what appeared to be her going-away outfit while the groom and best man were dressed in prison-issue Primark tracksuits, still wearing their mud-stained wedding shoes. Professional fighter Eamonn, , who was sporting a head injury when he was freed, gave an address in Uddingston, South Lanarkshire, as did his -year-old we and his -year-old brother. CCTV footage which reportedly captured the fight spilling out of the wedding venue onto the lawn outside, persuaded the trio’s legal team to negotiate guilty pleas to a reduced number of charges at Livingston Sherf Court. Claire Goodbrand pled guilty on indictment to assault to injury but not guilty to a more serious assault to severe injury. She admitted repeatedly seizing her mother by the hair, punching and kicking her on the head and body, causing her to fall to the ground, before striking her head at The Vue wedding venue at Ballencrieff Toll in West Lothian’s Bathgate Hills. She also admitted punching and kicking her mum Cherry-Ann to the head and body whilst she was on the ground, striking her on the head with a shoe and seizing her by the neck and restricting her breathing.  Eamonn and Kieran both pled guilty to repeatedly punching and kicking David Boyd on the head and body while acting together. The charge states that they caused him to fall to the ground and continued their violent attack as he lay there. They admitted pushing their thumbs into Mr Boyd’s eyes, biting him on the head and body and repeatedly seizing him by the neck and restricting his breathing, all to his severe injury. In addition, Kieran Goodbrand admitted assaulting Garry Brown by punching and kicking him on the head and body to his injury at the reception on  June . A fourth member of the family, -year-old Brendan Goodbrand, had his not guilty pleas to two assault charges accepted by the Crown after his alibi that he had left the venue before trouble broke out turned out to be true. Sherf Martin Edington called for criminal justice social work reports on all three accused before passing sentence. He adjourned the case until  April for information on possible disposals, including social work supervision, unpaid hours of work and restriction of liberty by electronic curfew. Eamonn Goodbrand’s Facebook page reveals that he works as a professional fighter, boxing competitively as a light middleweight. It was reported after the wedding reception that one of the alleged victims lost part of a finger during the attack. The prosecution will narrate the full circumstances when the case calls for sentence.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON CCTVWeddingsCCTV footageCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: couple dined lavish meal scallops
story: Couple dined on lavish meal of scallops and steak then left without paying £ billSergio Murtas, the owner of Sergios, says the couple ordered "the most expensive food and wine" including scallops and steak before leaving the Guisborough restaurantThe owner of Sergios has said they are prepared to hand over CCTV of a couple who dined and dashed to police Image: Bristol LiveByKelley PriceAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA couple dined on scallops and steak while washing it down with booze before leaving the restaurant without paying.Sergio Murtas, the owner of Sergioaposs, has warned the couple on Facebook that he will hand over CCTV of them dining and dashing to police unless they come forward to settle the bill. He says the couple ordered the most expensive food and wine at the Guisborough restaurant, TeessideLive reports.Their tab came to £ as many online are calling on the out-of-pocket restaurant owner to name and shame the couple by sharing the images online. In a statement on its Facebook page, the venue warned: For the couple that racked up an £ bill at pm tonight and then just left we have you on CCTV and will get the police involved, in the case that you do not come back and settle this bill as soon as possible.  Sergio said the restaurant was giving the couple more time to come forward before contacting the police. He said: They haven’t got back to us. we canapost be too sureit was deliberate. They weren’t regulars and they did order the most expensive food and wine on our menu, therefore we thought it was deliberate. I haven’t yet contacted the police yet. They did order king scallops as starter, fillet steak and a bottle of one of our best white wines and another couple of drinks. Sergio said a similar incident had only happened once before in the  years. He added: I just want to give them the benefit of the doubt. Posters on Facebook have voiced their disgust at the couple. One wrote: Some people have the cheek of the devil, don’t understand how they have the audacity to just get up and leave without paying. Another added: Itaposs terrible, donapost eat outyou canapost afford it. Businesses are struggling just the same as iniduals. news uk-news covid-tests-remain-free-charge-"Boris Johnson confirms end to free Covid testsByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Free lateral flow tests are only going to still be available for a small number of groups including NHS staff and care staff. Health Secretary Sajid Javid said that tests will no longer be free for the vast majority of the British public, meaning they will have to paythey want to test under the new plans.But the government announced today that a small number of groups will be able to still access the tests for free. Evensomeone is symptomatic they will no longer be told to test, instead urged to isolate until the symptoms pass. From April , the tests are being massively scaled back as apart of the final stage of the government’s plan to live with Covid. However, some people will still have access even after universal testing ends.  On top of this, the government did specy thata new iant of concern emerges then it could be expanded once more. After Friday, the groups who will still have access to free lateral flow tests, when they are asymptomatic, are: • Patient-facing staff in the NHS and NHS-commissioned healthcare providers • Staff in hospices and adult social care services • A small number of care home visitors who provide personal care • Staff in some prisons and places of detention • Staff in high-risk domestic abuse refuges and homelessness settingsThen, for people who have symptoms, more groups will still have access to testing whilst symptomatic. This will include: • Certain hospital patients who need access to treatments and ongoing clinical surveillance for new iants. • People who are otherwise eligible for community Covid treatments as they are more vulnerable,• And people discharged from hospitals into care homes and similar settings.During an outbreak accessibility to asymptomatic testing will be expanded further. This will go on to include residential special needs and disability schools, and care home staff and residents. Whilst the above will have access to tests when asymptomatic, there are plans in place to make sure free tests are available for some with Covid symptoms. From now on, people who have symptoms, instead of testing, should try to stay home and avoid contact with other people until any symptoms pass. This includes school children.  Mr Javid said: Thanks to our plan to tackle COVID, we are leading the way in learning to live with the virus. We have made enormous progress but will keep the ability to respond to future threats including potential iants. Vaccines remain our best defence and we are now offering spring boosters to the elderly, care home residents and the most vulnerable - please come forward to protect yourself, your family, and your community. One of the reasons the government withdrew the testing programme, as well as believing the country had progressed past the need for such surveillance, was due to the heavy costs. The government said free testing, tracing and isolation cost more than £. billion over the past two years. title: family dad be 31 who
story: Family of dad-to-be, , who died days before baby was born claim he was attackedNathan Hole, , of Camborne, Cornwall, suffered a seizure and went into cardiac arrest after a night of drinking heavily and taking cocaine. But his family say it was a fight which caused his deathNathan Hole died days before he was due to become a father for a fourth time Image: Kayleigh Rosevear WSByChris MatthewsRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Mar  The grieving family of a dad-to-be who died on a night out days before his baby was born have challenged the findings of his inquest.Nathan Hole, of Camborne, Cornwall, suffered a cardiac arrest at a friendaposs house hours after drinking heavily and taking cocaine.Senior coroner Andrew Cox ruled the -year-oldaposs death was drug-related after a postmortem put his passing down to the toxic effects of the class A substance, reports CornwallLive. However, Nathanaposs mum Rebecca Reynolds, a nurse, told the court in Truro she had evidence he was ambushed while walking back from a bar and thugs jumped on his head. She said she felt let down by the police, who had initially treated the death as murder, with two people arrested and later released. Thermal engineer Nathan, who had three other children, had been involved in a series of fights while out with friends at the townaposs Cafe Sol bar, the court heard. At one stage, at around pm on the night in question in July , a man threw a glass and he and Nathan exchanged several punches. Nathan was thrown into some bin bags before the pair were separated and both left the scene. During that fight he was described as unsteady on his feet but highly agitated and bouncing on his feet, at the hearing.  A pathologist’s report found no evidence to suggest any such physical altercation may have resulted in Nathanaposs death. After the scuffle he had gone to the house of friend Darren Lazenby in Cross Street where he was said to be highly agitated and banged his head on the landing. Shortly after, he began fitting, and other people at the house called the emergency services. Ms Reynolds said during the delay between him leaving the fight and arriving at the property, she believes he was jumped by two men. PC Thomas Kerr described how police and paramedics were called to the address where they encountered a chaotic scene with lots of people and furniture in the way. Nathan was pronounced dead at the scene. Also giving evidence was Nathan’s partner of  years, Kayleigh Rosevear. She said he only drank and took drugs recreationally, adding: He knew how to have a good time. Miss Rosevear said that Nathan twice called her in the hours before his death and was loving, soppy and “his usual self”. for our daily newsletter to keep up to date with all the essential information at www.mirror email During her evidence, Ms Reynolds, said: “We have evidence he didn’t go straight to the flat and was jumped on by two men, standing on his head. “The boys he was with gave totally dferent stories that night. I feel Nathan hasn’t had full justice. He was just . A lot of people take drugs in Camborne and don’t die like that. He was a healthy boy. Why did they take so long to call an ambulance and leave my son to die ” Ms Reynolds claimed other people present were more concerned with hiding drugs before the emergency services were called. Mr Cox reminded Ms Reynolds that experts’ reports had shown there was no link between Nathan’s death and the violence that night. In a statement, Mr Lazenby said his long-time pal Nathan had been taking cocaine on and off for a few days and that they had done several lines together outside Cafe Sol. Regarding the fight, Mr Lazenby said it was like handbags. The statement also said he didnapost know where Nathan went between the fight and him receiving a call saying he was having a seizure at his house. Concluding the inquest, Mr Cox said Nathan was too young to die. He said Nathan had had plenty to drink and was taking regular amounts of cocaine, and got involved in at least one or two fights on the night he died. The coroner said at the Cross Street flat he was agitated and swearing profusely, banging his head several times. He added that a police investigation found a lack of evidence supporting claims anyone  was involved in his death. title: haunting wreck downed brit wwii
story: Haunting wreck of shot-down plane which left  dead washes up on beachThe downed plane has been identied as a Short Stirling MK and is thought to be the aircraft brought down by a German night fighter in December  - killing all eight crewmenParts of a British bomber downed during the Second World War which has washed up on the shores of North Holland Image: NewsflashByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A plane downed by Nazi night fighters leaving eight crew members dead has washed up  years later on a beach in Europe. The downed bomber has been identied as a Short Stirling MK, specically listed as the Short Stirling BF aeroplane - as each inidual aircraft came with its own designation during the war.The British WWII bomber Short Stirling is believed to have been shot down by a German night fighter on December ,  - killing all eight crew members. Short Stirlings were British bombers used in the war against Nazi Germany before the aircraft was relegated to second-line supplier duties in late . The wreckage was found on a beach in Camperduin, a small village in the Dutch province of North Holland in February. But it has only now been identied as a % British wartime bomber.  Martijn Visser of the Egmond Foundation apos-apos, which is based at the Bunkermuseum Jansje Schong, in the village of Egmond aan Zee, on the North Sea coast, in the Dutch province of North Holland, said that after careful checks, he was now % certain that it is a British plane. He added: Often small pieces wash ashore, but such a large part as now is really unique. The -year-old, whose day job is working as an electrician and running his own company, said: On the wreckage pictures you can see A.M., which stands for aposAir Ministryapos, this was used during WWII on aircraft parts. The Air Ministry was a British Government department that oversaw the Royal Air Force from between  and .Visser said: We came into possession of some Dutch and German documents which mentioned the crash of a Short Stirling into the sea in the vicinity of Camperduin. We compared our wreckage with the only remaining fuselage of a Short Stirling in the Netherlands and it was a % match. The expert researched the aircraft wreckage and came across the Dutch airbase of Deelen, where the only remaining hull of a Short Stirling can be seen in its museum. He and other researchers determined that the remains of the wrecked British bombers came from the same type of combat aircraft. Visser said: A total of three Stirlings crashed off our coast, two near Bergen aan Zee and one near Camperduin. We are % sure that the wreckage came from the latter.  He said of the plane that crashed so near to safety: They were almost home. Visser added: By the time you reached the Dutch coast, you were pretty safe. He said: They named the area between Castricum and Egmond aan Zee aposthe gapapos because there was little anti-aircraft artillery there.”  Short Stirlings were used for mining German ports before being used as a supplier craft during the Allied invasion of Europe in -. The Allied invasion saw the United States, the United Kingdom, and the Free French Forcesfirst invade Italy, after defeating the Nazis in North Africa, before landing in Normandy on June , , in what has come to be known as the D-Day landings, officially called Operation Overlord. title: man caught drinking water vodka
story: Man caught drinking water from vodka bottle tells police hes being eco-friendlyThames Valley Police responded to reports of a man swigging booze from a vodka bottle while behind the wheel in a car park in Reading - but when they arrived and breathalysed him, they found he was under the limitA driver was stopped by police after admitting to drinking from a bottle of vodka - which actually turned out to be water Image: TVP Roads Policing   SWNSByLauren BeavisRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsPolice who pulled over a driver drinking from a bottle of vodka discovered it was full of water with the suspect claiming he was just being eco-friendly. Thames Valley Police stopped the man in Reading after receiving a call about someone drinking from a Vodka bottle in a car park.Police officers stopped them a short distance down the road driving onto the A. After a below zero level on the breathalyser, the inidual revealed that the bottle was filled with water. They admitted they like to drink from glass bottles and not plastic and the vodka bottle was the largest bottle they [had].TVP Roads Policing Facebook said: Received a [text] earlier about a person sat in their [car] drinking from a bottle of vodka in a car park looking like they were about to drive away in the green park area of #Reading. [Vehicle] located and stopped a short distance down the road driving onto the #A. Driver admitted to drinking from the vodka bottle on their passenger seat, but surprisingly blew zero on the breathalyser… It transpires that it’s actually filled with water, as they like to drink from glass bottles and not plastic… and this is the largest bottle they have! Some friendly words of advice given to try and prevent further unnecessary calls. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  People have taken to the comments section to voice their opinions on the incident: One person wrote to the police: I think they were hoping for this to wind you up and waste your time. Another said: Friendly words of advice  The driver has done nothing wrong, Itaposs better drinking out of a glass bottle. I hope the friendly advice was just to peel the label off the bottle. One blatantly concluded: Not illegal though is it. It appears this driver isnapost the only one, however, as two women joke about their grandmother who allegedly carries her squash in a wine bottle - to which another family member responded: lol always in a wine bottle. title: moment unlucky motorists vehicle becomes
story: Moment unlucky motorists vehicle becomes submerged in sea by incoming tideThe stranded vehicle had its bonnet submerged as the waterline creeps around the windshield and side mirrors in Porth Eirias, Colwyn Bay near LlandudnoThis is the moment a car becomes submerged in the sea by incoming tide at Porth Eirias, Colwyn Bay in Llandudno Image: RNLI Llandudno WSByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsThis is the dramatic moment a car becomes submerged in the sea by the incoming tide. Leboat volunteers, coastguard officers and members of the public raced to save the vehicle. The image shows the stranded vehicle with the water covering the bonnet as the waterline creeps around the windshield and side mirrors near Llandudno.Rescue crews did their best to save the car on Monday evening, but it could not be saved, DailyPost reports. Llandudnoaposs inshore leboat Dr Barbara Saunderson was taken away from a training exercise in Llandudno Bay when the alarm was raised. The leboat team was called in to assist the coastguard after the vehicle became submerged in the water due to the tide.  The vehicle was at Porth Eirias, Colwyn Bay, when the tide came in. The incoming tide submerged the car despite the best efforts from the leboat crew and the coastguard team. RNLI crew member Luke Heritage said: Regrettably we could not achieve a recovery but did leave a marker buoy as a navigational aid for a submerged hazard. It is unclear who the unlucky owner is, but no injuries were reported. In , an unlucky motorist was left helpless when their car got stuck in sand at a Welsh beauty spot and was submerged by the tide.The white people carrier was stranded but could not be recovered until Sunday when the tide went out again. The car had parked on the sands on the beach at Cemaes, a village on the north coast of Anglesey in Wales but the fast-moving tide caught out the driver.  A Jeep tried to help the car as the tide came in - however, it also got stuck, reports the Daily Post.A passing canoeist was able to get this picture of the stricken vehicle. A tractor was able to save the Jeep but the white people carrier, complete with the sunroof open, was lost to the sea. It was stuck overnight in the middle of the bay. On Sunday it was pulled back to the beach by a tractor. title: mum celebrates miracle pregnancy after
story: Mum-to-be celebrates miracle pregnancy after birth control left her infertileAlana Hunt from Essex didnt have a period for two years after she came off the contraceptive pill Microgynon and she was then diagnosed with pill-induced Polycystic Oy Syndrome Alana Hunt is celebrating her miracle pregnancy after the contraceptive pill left her infertile Image: North News  Pictures Ltd northnewsByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar " data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _PAY-NNP-PREGNANCY_JOY_.jpg" data-tracking"facebook|share|top"" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _PAY-NNP-PREGNANCY_JOY_.jpg" data-tracking"twitter|share|top"" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _PAY-NNP-PREGNANCY_JOY_.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"|comments A mum-to-be is celebrating her miracle pregnancy after her birth control left her infertile.Alana Hunt didnapost have a period for two years after she came off the contraceptive pill Microgynon.She was then diagnosed with pill-induced Polycystic Oy Syndrome . She was given fertility drugs, but it took her a further  months to fall pregnant. Alana, , of Essex, is now expecting her first child with fiancée Jack Costin, . She said: I started taking the pill because I was bleeding for three weeks every cycle and was getting anaemic. It suppressed my periods and seemed like a good solution at the time. I had no idea it would take so long for them to come back once I stopped taking the pill, or that it would be another two years before I managed to have a healthy pregnancy.I do want people to remember stories like mine are very uncommon, and things like this typically donapost happen. A lot of the time, birth control isnapost the root cause of the problem, but it can make pre-existing problems that you are unaware of so much worse and harder to manage.  Alana now urges people to do research in case they could be negatively affected. She said: Make sure you do a lot of your own research - donapost just go with the first thing suggested to you. Go with the option that feels right for you, and remember you can always change your mind once youaposve started. Alana, who works in marketing, started taking the pill when she was  following a year of abnormal periods.She came off it five years later in  because she thought it was impacted her mental health. When Alana was  she knew she wasnapost ready to have a child, but knew she wanted to be a mum one day. She grew concerned when her periods had not come back. In January , she saw a doctor after not having her period for two years. Alana was diagnosed with Pill-Induced PCOS and was given metformin, inositol supplementsand a week course of norethisterone to induce a period. In October , she fell pregnant but sadly miscarried.After further treatment, Alana fell pregnant on New Yearaposs Eve in . Now, she is four months pregnant and scans show her unborn baby is in good health. Alana added: I feel immensely blessed and grateful to be pregnant because at times it never felt like we would get to this point. However, Iaposve mostly been anxious. Going through infertility and pregnancy loss meant that when I did fall pregnant, I assumed things would eventually go wrong. In early pregnancy, I would take a test pretty much every single day and compare the line to the day before to check it was getting darker. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  I had scans at week , , , and , and I didnapost look forward to any of them. I felt guilty about it at the time, but I always had the worry in the back of my mind that I would get bad news. The anxiety gets easier as the weeks go by. This pregnancy has gone perfectly and I havenapost had a single complication or any reason to worry, but the anxiety never goes away. But I am excited to welcome this child. Everything we have gone through definitely feels worth it. news uk-news prince-andrew-defiant-royals-blanked-"Queen arrives at Prince Philips memorial with Prince AndrewByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsPrince Andrew looked “defiant” at Prince Philip’s memorial service where he was blanked by all the royals apart from the Queen, a body language expert is reported to have said.The Duke of York escorted the Queen from Windsor Castle to the Thanksgiving of Le service at Westminster Abbey but was given the cold shoulder by other members of the Royal Family.Surprisingly, having been removed from public le and paying suspected millions to settle a civil sexual assault case involving Virginia Giuffre, Andrew was given a prominent role alongside his mother. But her warmth appeared not to be shared by other royals, said body language expert Judi James, who claimed that they “pretended to not even see him”.Only Prince Harry and Meghan Markle of the senior royals were not at the service that were attended also by friends and people who benefitted from his charities and patronages. With around , people attending the thanksgiving event it was a very dferent scene to Philip’s funeral last year that was held with minimal mourners due to Covid restrictions. Andrew took his seat next to Edward in the front row at the church after escorting the Queen.Ms James told the Daily Mail: “Taking his place next to Edward he cut an isolated but defiant-looking figure, but there were no glances or even nods of greeting and no discernible eye contact. The eye-avoidance looked deliberate, with most of the Firm staring pointedly ahead as though barely even aware of him.”She pointed out how Edward and Sophie have been used by the Royal Family as buffers on other occasions but there was no “warmth” this time.  And she honed in on the closeness of the relationship that the Queen has with Andrew. The message from the Queen about her prodigal son Andrew looked unequivocal today. As her eldest son Charles is fond of saying, this is now clearly a aposnon-negotiableapos relationship, said Ms James. Not only did she choose her second son to accompany and support her as she walked into the Abbey, making this the first time she has been seen in public accepting assistance from anyone, she also paused before they parted to take their seats and threw him a smile of thanks in front of UK and foreign royalty as well as the eyes of the rest of the world. The body language expert also felt that there was a non-verbal arrogance from Andrew which she picked up by the wave that he gave to photographers. Andrewaposs bearing was upright and almost military. Those spectacles perched on the end of his nose suggested his tendency to non-verbal arrogance is still holding firm, while his wave to the cameras could be seen as something of a victory role, Ms James added. title: prince andrews smug behaviour philips
story: Prince Andrews smug behaviour at Philips memorial once again lets down the QueenPrince Andrews public appearance alongside the Queen at Prince Philips memorial service today was arrogant, smug and tone deaf. He has let the Queen down once again, says Polly HudsonThe Duke of York, right, with his late father Prince Philip and mother Queen Elizabeth Image: Getty ImagesopinionByPolly Hudson:,  Mar |comments It doesn’t feel that controversial an opinion to say that I never want to see Prince Andrew again.Hard not to assume that most people feel the same way. So it seems impossible that Andrew, and those around him, aren’t aware of that. They must know exactly how popular he is, and that there is nothing that will ever change that.Of course Andrew is entitled to go to a memorial service for his father – but it is utterly tone deaf of him not to have read the room. He clearly should have slipped into the building quietly, sat somewhere discreet, tried to be as invisible as possible. To instead arrogantly rock up front and centre stage, even travelling in a car with the star of the show, is appalling behaviour, even by his standards.If his mother needed assistance on the journey, and down the aisle, there are plenty of other family members who could – who should – have been by her side instead.Andrew has let the poor Queen down, yet again, on what was already a testing day for many reasons. He shouldn’t have put her in that position, he should have insisted on travelling alone, being seated separately, definitely not in the front row, of all places.Sitting smugly in the hot seat makes it seem like he doesn’t understand the seriousness of what has happened, the cloud over him that will never go away – or that he simply doesn’t care. In reality it’s hardly a shock that Andrew hasn’t done the right thing –he was man of honour and integrity he would have nothing to apologise for. Which, let’s never forget, he never has. Palace insiders believe that after today he will effectively disappear from public le. Good riddance. Don’t let the palace door hit you on the way out.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgePrince GeorgePrincess CharlottePrince Philip, Duke of EdinburghPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal FamilyThe Queen" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news prince-harrys-pathetic-excuse-skipping-"Prince Harrys absence big disappointment says Richard GrfinByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  Mar |comments Guests at the Duke of Edinburghaposs memorial service were discussing Prince Harry and Meghan Markleaposs decision to skip the event, with the late royalaposs former protection officer describing their excuse for not attending as nonsense. Richard Grfin, who was responsible for the safety of both the Queen and Prince Philip for  years, was a guest at todayaposs event but was disappointed the Duke and Duchess of Sussex decided against ing to the UK to pay their respects.Harry has said heaposs unable toto the UK due to safety concerns, which have become the subject of his latest legal battle - this time against the Home Office. Speaking to Sky News, Richard said: William had a great training from [Prince Philip] and is going to learn all his examples for him. Fingers crossed, I just hope Harry gets some of these things into his mind.Asked about his decision not to attend, he said: That was a big disappointment for everybody. He also said that members of the ,-strong congregation were discussing Harryaposs absence before the service began. He said: Certainly around where I was they thought he should have been here. All this nonsense about he couldnapost get protection, as far as Iaposm concerned that was a pathetic excuse, he should have been here to honour his grandfather. At the end of the day,he was that worried about security he could have stuck with his brother and father who have got wonderful security. He would have been more than safe.Richard worked for the royal family for over a decade and said todayaposs service captured the Duke perfectly. Speaking about todayaposs event, he said: To see the Queen come in and sit with her family, that was wonderful.It was very emotional. I worked with Prince Philip for  years and travelled the world with him, I did a lot of things with him and deeply missed him when he died.Prince Philip had a big footprint on the service, you could see it right the way through. It was fantastic to be able to come today and pay our respects. It was a wonderful, wonderful service. He was the most caring man you could possibly meet.  He also shared a story about when his son was diagnosed with cancer and Philip called the hospital to check on him. He also wrote to his we to check on her and on another occassion arranged transport so Mr Grfinaposs daughter could make it home Christmas. Todayaposs event paid tribute to Prince Philipaposs charity work and decades of service to the Queen and the royal family. The Dean of Westminster delivered a moving speech about the Duke. He said: He would hate to think that I should paint a picture of him as a ‘plaster saint’ someone without the usual human foibles and failings. He was far too self-aware ever to be taken in by flattery. Of course, it must be said that his le bore the marks of sacrice and service.  Certainly, he could show great sympathy and kindness. There is no doubt that he had a delightfully engaging, and often self-deprecating, sense of humour. It is quite clear that his mind held together both speculation and common sense. Moreover, nobody would ever doubt his loyalty and deep devotion to our Queen and to their family. Yet, there were times when he could be abrupt maybe, in robust conversation, forgetting just how intimidating he could be. A kind of natural reserve sometimes made him seem a little distant. He could be somewhat sharp in pricking what he thought to be bubbles of pomposity or sycophancy. On the other hand, we should not forget that he himself was sometimes wounded by being unfairly criticised or misunderstood. Like the rest of us, he was part of flawed humanity. Unlike most of us however, he was one of those rare people who remained true to, and guided by, what you might call ‘an inner spiritual compass’ a sense of being called to play a part in the making of a God-intended world. As we give thanks for the le of a remarkable man, perhaps out greatest tribute to him, most especially in these far too troubled times, will be for us to accept the challenge, implicit in his le, to rekindle in our hearts something of that call, and to prayfor the inspiration and the guidance to play our part, however small, in working for a kinder future. news uk-news princess-charlottes-adorable-exchange-princess-"Princesses Charlotte and Beatrice share sweet exchange at Prince Phillips memorialByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsTodayaposs memorial service for the late Prince Philip brought together nearly all members of the Royal Family to honour their much-loved relative.And it wasnapost just the Queen, her children and her grandchildren that were at the ceremony at Westminster Abbey this morning.Also in attendance were some of the youngest royals, including the Duke and Duchess of Cambridgeaposs children Prince George and Princess Charlotte.The Cambridge family sat near the front of the Abbey in a row in front of Prince Williamaposs cousins Princess Beatrice and Princess Eugenie, who were accompanied by their husbands Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi and Jack Brooksbank. And an adorable moment was spotted between Charlotte and Beatrice as the congregation sang a hymn earlier today.Footage shows that as Charlotte gazed around the huge building as the congregation sang, the young princess caught the eye of Beatrice behind her. As the pair locked eyes, Beatrice gave an exaggerated smile to Charlotte, who ingave a wide smile back to her dadaposs cousin. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . After spotting the moment on TV, royal fans took to Twitter to share their delight at the cute moment.One wrote: Aw I have a feeling they have always had a lovely relationship! A pic from Eugenie’s wedding comes to mind. While another said: Looks like Charlotte looks up to her. Bless.However, it wasnapost the only sweet moment Charlotte had at todayaposs ceremony - she also said hello another of the Queenaposs young great granddaughters, Mia Tindall. As Charlotte left the service alongside her parents William and Kate, Zara could be seen pointing out the young princess to Mia, who was sat beside her. And as they passed each other, Mia gave her younger relative a huge wave as they left the service. Charlotte, Mia and their siblings have all been pictured together at events in the past with Prince William seemingly having a close relationship with his cousin Zara. The young royals were led at the service by the Queen, who arrived at Westminster Abbey arm-in-arm with her son Prince Andrew to pay a final tribute to her beloved husband Prince Philip, despite concerns she wouldnapost be able to attend for health reasons. Dressed in a dark green coat, the Queen used a walking stick as she took her seat in the front row of the packed abbey, next to Prince Charles and Camilla. The Queen only made the final decision to attend this morning and special arrangements were put in place for her comfort. news uk-news princess-charlottes-adorable-reaction-spots-"Princess Charlotte adorably reacts to seeing herself on screenByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsPrincess Charlotte had a big day yesterday as she was among the youngest guests at Prince Philipaposs memorial service. Her appearance at the event was her first outing at a public royal church service alongside her older brother Prince George.The pair were accompanied to the ceremony by their parents the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge - and they were seen shaking hands with officials and joining in with the hymns.And TV cameras caught Charlotte in one particularly adorable moment midway through the ceremony. The event took place at Westminster Abbey and TV screen were dotted around the building to ensure everyone attending could watch proceedings.  While gazing around the enormous landmark, cameras picked up Charlotte noticing herself on the TV screens as she sat alongside mum Kate. Footage shows the young princess jumping up in her seat after spotting herself and pulling a wry smile.The moment was spotted by royal fan Twitter account @RoyalReporterUK - and others couldnapost help but comment on her sweet response.One wrote: Princess Charlotte is so cute! While another said: Oh thataposs just adorable. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .Meanwhile one added: You canapost help but smile when you see this. However, it wasnapost Charlotteaposs only blink and youaposll miss it adorable moment at yesterdayaposs service.The Cambridge family sat near the front of the Abbey in a row in front of Prince Williamaposs cousins Princess Beatrice and Princess Eugenie, who were accompanied by their husbands Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi and Jack Brooksbank.And an adorable moment was spotted between Charlotte and Beatrice as the congregation sang a hymn.Footage shows that as Charlotte gazed around the huge building as the congregation sang, the young princess caught the eye of Beatrice behind her. As the pair locked eyes, Beatrice gave an exaggerated smile to Charlotte, who ingave a wide smile back to her dadaposs cousin.  The young royals were led at the service by the Queen to pay a final tribute to her beloved husband Prince Philip, despite concerns she wouldnapost be able to attend for health reasons. Dressed in a dark green coat, the Queen used a walking stick as she took her seat in the front row of the packed abbey, next to Prince Charles and Camilla.The Queen only made the final decision to attend that morning and special arrangements were put in place for her comfort. news uk-news princess-charlottes-sweet-moment-mia-"Mia Tindall gives small wave at Cambridges as they passByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsSome of the youngest members of the Royal Family paid tribute to their late great-grandfather Prince Philip at his memorial service today.They included the Duke and Duchess of Cambridgeaposs children Prince George and Princess Charlotte as well as Zara and Mike Tindallaposs oldest daughter Mia Tindall.And once the service honouring Philipaposs le was over, Charlotte and Mia were seen enjoying a sweet moment together as they spotted each other in the Abbey.As Charlotte left the service alongside her parents William and Kate, Zara could be seen pointing out the young princess to Mia, who was sat beside her.And as they passed each other, Mia gave her younger relative a huge wave as they left the service. Charlotte, Mia and their siblings have all been pictured together at events in the past with Prince William seemingly having a close relationship with his cousin Zara.However, it wasnapost the only cute moment that Charlotte had at the ceremony today - she was also spotted smiling at her dadaposs cousin Princess Beatrice, who sat behind the Cambridge family in the Abbey. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . As Charlotte gazed around the huge building as the congregation sang a hymn, the young princess caught the eye of Beatrice.The pair then exchanged cute smiles before they went back to joining in with the hymn.The young royals were led at the service by the Queen, who arrived at Westminster Abbey arm-in-arm with her son Prince Andrew to pay a final tribute to her beloved husband Prince Philip, despite concerns she wouldnapost be able to attend for health reasons.  Dressed in a dark green coat, the Queen used a walking stick as she took her seat in the front row of the packed abbey, next to Prince Charles and Camilla. The Queen only made the final decision to attend this morning and special arrangements were put in place for her comfort.The service was limited to  minutes and the monarch sat in one of the Canada chairs but with an additional cushion. Among the other royals there were the Earl and Countess of Wessex and their children Lady Louise Windsor and Viscount Severn.Others attending were the Princess Royal and Vice Admiral Sir Tim Laurence, Peter Phillips and his daughters Savannah and Isla.Prince and Princess Michael of Kent, the Duke of Kent and the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester made up the rest of the royal attendees. title: queen made colossal mistake letting
story: Queen made colossal mistake by letting Prince Andrew to escort her to Philip memorialChoosing to be escorted to and from Westminster Abbey by a man who paid a reported £-million to settle a sordid sex case to avoid court was deeply distastefulPrince Andrew and the Queen arrive at the memorial service Image: PAopinionByKevin MaguireAssociate editor:,  Mar What a cynical, gratuitously offensive attempt by the Queen to rehabilitate shamed son Andrew. Buckingham Palace will calculate an elderly monarchaposs above criticism on the day of her dear, dead husbandaposs memorial service. But choosing to be escorted to and from Westminster Abbey by a man who paid a reported £-million to settle a sordid sex case to avoid court was deeply distasteful. It wasnapost a sweet old maaposam who wanted to travel from Windsor Castle in state limousine with a scoundrel shunned since paying off a woman who alleged when a teenager she was force to sleep with a dad of two old enough to be her own father.  This was an elderly monarch exploiting sympathy at a personal yet very public event to walk back into polite society a reviled man forced to give up even honorary membership of a posh golf club over the scandals spewing from a close friendship with a convicted paedophile and his jailed fixer. What Virginia Giuffre makes of it one can only imagine but much of the watching world, particularly women victims of abuse, will have been revolted. The removal of his military titles and royal patronages, including the use of a His Royal Highness title, look a ersion.  The Duke of York, her favourite son, remains promoted despite stomach-churning behaviour that shouldaposve seen tainted Andrew seated out of sight at the back behind a pillar. Perhaps age and frailty are distorting her judgement because this was a colossal mistake by a declining monarch. She put her son and family before decency, trying to sell a leper to the country at a service commemorating her husband. Knee-bending courtiers will struggle from now on to argue sheaposs principled and does what is right in the service of the country.  She held on to Andrewaposs arm but it was her parading him. He continues to deny the claim but embracing the humiliated sex case settler damaged her own reputation. After the disastrous royal colonial relic tour of the Caribbean, the head of the creaking institution also undermined a family business suddenly feeling very out of date. news uk-news queen-mother-left-prince-harry-"Royals: Prince Harry reveals he will attend Invictus GamesByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |comments The Royal Family will be pausing today to remember the Queen Mother who died exactly  years ago today.She was close with many of her grandchildren and great-grandchildren and was seemingly thinking about their finances long before her death. She reportedly put a large chunk of her money into a trust fund, to be split between all her great-grandchildren.But the Queen Mother had an agreement that Prince Harry would get more than Prince William.So, when she passed away aged , the brothers had £million to split between them, but as agreed the younger brother did better out of the deal.  The logic behind the Queen Motheraposs decision is based on how finances within the royal family work.When the Queen dies and Prince Charles becomes king, William will likely become the new Prince of Wales.This means he will inherit the Duchy of Cornwall, a private estate that funds the public, charitable and private activities of the heir to the throne. Harry, on the other hand, wonapost get any of this. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . The cash, along with the inheritance he got from his mum, Princess Diana, has helped him start his new le in the US with Meghan Markle after they quit the royal family in .The couple are now said to be a lot happier, living the dream le in the sunshine with their two beautul children. Diana left her boys £,, which was reduced to £,, after death duties.  After the Queen Motheraposs death, Buckingham Palace revealed some details about her will after going to the High Court to try to keep it private. Her estate was valued at between £m and £m at the time, was passed onto her daughter the Queen. Many items from the Queenaposs private art collection were given to the royal collection and went on display at Buckingham Palace. A statement released at the time read: Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother has bequeathed her entire estateto The Queen. In her will, she asked The Queen to make certain bequests to members of her staff, and these bequests will be subject to Inheritance Tax in the normal way. The Queen has decided that the most important of Queen Elizabethaposs pictures and works of art should be transferred to the Royal Collection. title: three month old baby girl
story: Three-month-old baby girl killed in husky attack died from head and neck injuriesKyra Leanne King sustained head and neck injuries in a dog attack in the car park of Ostler’s Plantation, a wooded area near Woodhall Spa, Lincs, at .pm on  MarchKyra Leanne King died at Ostlers Plantation Image: James Turner Lincolnshire LiveByPaul Whitelam:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar A three-month-old baby girl reportedly killed by a aposHuskyapos died from head and neck injuries, an inquest heard this morning. Kyra Leanne King lost her le in the car park area of Ostler’s Plantation, a wooded area near Woodhall Spa, Lincs, at .pm on  March.Two people were arrested following the death, but they have been released under investigation, Lincolnshire Live reported. Assistant Coroner for Lincolnshire Paul Cooper today opened the inquest into Kyraaposs death during a short hearing at the Myle Cross Centre in Lincoln. Lincolnshire Police Detective Chief Superintendent Andy Cox previously said: “This is an exceptionally sad incident, and one that we know will impact the local community, or indeed anyone hearing about it. “There may be a temptation to speculate about what happened while people attempt to understand this tragedy, and we’d ask people to avoid doing so, particularly on social media where facts can become distorted.  We will do everything we can to establish what has happened, and we’d like to thank everyone for their support.” The inquest heard evidence from Coroneraposs Officer Jackie Foxlow who confirmed that East Midlands Ambulance Service were called to Ostleraposs Plantation. A preliminary postmortem carried out by Forensic Pathologist Dr Stuart Hamilton at Leicester Royal Infirmary recorded the provisional cause of death as head and neck injuries. The inquest opening also heard evidence from temporary Detective Inspector Cally Murray, who told the hearing it remained a live investigation and enquiries into the circumstances are continuing while two people remain under investigation. The officer said the child died after sustaining injuries from a dog attack, but added that investigators were keeping an open mind about the incident generally. Lincolnshire Police will be seeking a destruction order against the dog, which has been seized and remains in kennels, once active proceedings are completed, the inquest heard. Assistant Coroner Cooper adjourned the inquest to a date to be fixed and said it could take some months for enquiries to be completed.  Assistant Coroner Cooper said: This is a sad case. There is a grieving family out there. Any social media comments could be hurtful. The breed of dog involved in the incident, which happened in the car park area of Ostler’s Plantation, was not disclosed during the hearing, but Lincolnshire Police have previously said they believed it to be a Husky. Officers launched an investigation into the death and previously arrested a -year-old woman and a -year-old man on suspicion of being in charge of a dog which was out of control. They were later released under investigation.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Lincolnshire PoliceDangerous dogsInquests" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman 23 travelled across world
story: American woman visiting UK boyfriend killed looking right instead of left crossing roadSelena Meyers had come to visit Stephen Buckley in Manchester from her native Tennessee, US, when tragedy struck as she crossed a road, looking right instead of leftSelena Meyers, from Tennessee, died in January  Image: GMPByAntony ThrowerNews ReporterNick JacksonStephen Topping:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar An American woman visiting her British boyfriend was killed crossing the road as she was looking the wrong way, an inquest was told.Selena Mystera Meyers and Stephen Buckley started a transatlantic romance after meeting online in . Tragedy struck in January  when the -year-old came to visit him in Eccles, Manchester, as she crossed a road and was hit by two cars. The drivers of the vehicles said Selena was looking to her right, as she would to cross safely in the US, but traffic drives on the other side of the road in Britain, Manchester Evening News reported.As a result she was hit by a Skoda, followed by a Renault Clio, the court heard. The Clio driver told proceedings: “She seemed to be looking the wrong way.  This made sense when I found out she was American. I know this because Iaposve done it myself when Iaposve been abroad - looking in the wrong direction for traffic. The Clio driver and her front-seat passenger told the inquest they simply did not see Selena as she was crossing the road, which has lighting on only one side. As a result, the driver did not brake with black box data fitted for her insurance company and retrieved from her car revealing she was driving mph when tragedy struck.  Stephen said the couple met talking in internet chatrooms in  after being introduced by a friend. He said: We used to speak on a regular basis and talked every other day. Over a period of time there was a mutual attraction, even though we hadnapost met physically. “This increased over time and the conversations would grow and we could talk about anything. “In  I asked her to be my girlfriend and I was overjoyed when she said yes. In July , Stephen visited Selena in Tennessee and met her grandparents, Donald and Florence Lee. He added: The time we spent together was magical.”  A statement previously released on behalf of the family said: My first beautul daughter, quiet, sweet and loving - a good daughter. She was an artist with an empathetic and kind soul, always creating, singing, painting and a writer of books and poetry. She always did charity work and was a loyal friend to Elizabeth Grogan - they were the best of friends through thick and thin all the years of her le. She lived with and was cared for by her great grandparents, Donald and Florence Lee up until she became a young lady. Her name Selena meant Moon Goddess - Mystara meant my stars. So she takes our moon and stars from us as she goes. “RIP my entire night sky - my first baby girl. news us-news woman-lived-cool-streak-under-"TikToker discovers cool streak on her nail is cancerByVanessa ChalmersSamantha Mordi:,  Mar |commentsA woman who thought a streak that had been growing on her nail for years was cool was horried to be told what it really was. Maria Sylvia said she first noticed the dark brown mark ten years ago - but thought nothing of it, as she was in and out of doctors all the time due to being an athlete.The Tik Toker - who has more than , followers - shared the news online after finding out it had probably been cancerous for the last three years. Doctors tol her it was subungual melanoma, a serious form of skin cancer that takes hold in the skin under your nails She said on her page @invrfoundwaldo : No one really noticed it until one time a doctor did notice it. This was probably circa , and they were like, aposoh, thataposs oddapos. But you donapost really fit the demographics. Maria, from the US, was offered surgery in which doctors removed her nail and part of the bone. She said: “Melanoma can sit in a stage called in situ, which is kind of like stage zero, for up to  years. “So itaposs very likely that this has just been sitting for  years and itaposs been maybe cancerous for the last three, itaposs kind of hard to tell.” When she woke up she had a cast covering her entire hand and stopped her thumb from moving as it recovered.Mariaaposs thumb was given a skin graft, with doctors taking flesh from her arm. Sheaposs now waiting to see what the final result will look like. He video, which has reached  million people, has left viewers worried about their own similar streaks. Medical advice warns that you should go and see a doctoryou see a change in size, colour, or shape of the nails. If your nail separates from the nail bed, bleeds, thins or cracks or has a bruise that wonapost go away - it could be a sign something is wrong. Melanoma is the worst form of skin cancer and is usually caused by eexposure to UV rays. But caught early, it has a good survival rate with  per cent of people survivingthe cancer is detected at stage one. There are still more than , melanoma skin cancer deaths in the UK every year. title: woman wins 80000 lottery coffee
story: Woman wins £, on lottery with coffee-stained ticket she binned by mistakeFrantic Mary Elliott, from Virginia, realised that she had thrown her ticket away and feared it wouldnt be considered valid because the barcode didnt scan after it became stainedMary Elliot, the Virginia woman who won the lottery after rescuing the ticket from the bin Image: Virginia Lottery NewsflashByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments A woman scooped an £, lottery prize binning the coffee-stained ticket by mistake.Frantic Mary Elliott, from Virginia, first realised that she had thrown her ticket away, but later found it in the trash. She was worried that the coffee stain would have made the ticket invalid after the barcode didnapost scan. However, she was still given the £, prize from Virginia Lotteryaposs Cash  with EZ Match game. Mary said: When I saw Iaposd won, I couldnapost stop shaking to save my le! Virginia Lottery said: When Mary Elliot discovered sheaposd matched all five winning numbers in the Virginia Lotteryaposs Cash  with EZ Match game, she had a brief moment of panic. She had thrown the ticket away!  So the Buckingham County woman went digging through the trash and found it. But now there was a new problem - The ticket had coffee stains on it, and the barcode wouldnapost scan when she tried to confirm her win. The lottery company added: But this story has a happy ending. Ms Elliott took the ticket to the Virginia Lotteryaposs Prize Zone West in Henrico, where Lottery officials were able to confirm the win and award her the USD , prize! Virginia Lottery said: She won the top prize in the February  drawing with a ticket she bought at the Food Lion in Dillwyn. The winning numbers were ----. She selected the numbers on her ticket using important birthdays. Cash  with EZ Match features a rolling jackpot, starting at a minimum of USD ,. If nobody matches all five winning numbers, the jackpot increases for the next drawing. However, not everyone who has damaged their ticket has been as lucky. Last year, one woman, lost out on a  millionjackpot, after allegedly putting her ticket in the laundry.The woman, who hasnapost been named, says she matched all six numbers back in November last year, after purchasing the ticket from a shop in Los Angeles, United States. She had  days to come into the store to claim her prize, however on the final day of the deadline she told the store manager what had happened.The womanaposs claim has even been backed up by the store manager, who has CCTV evidence of her coming into the shop and buying the winning ticket, but sadly lottery officials have said this isnapost enough for them to grant her the winnings, according to KLTA.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Virginia LotteryCCTVBettingCCTV footage" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. employees are really thinking whilst youaposre busy doing the food shop  Well hereaposs your chance to find out. Former Aldi employee Kelcey Atkinson has revealed what really makes her tick - and you might be one of the culprits.The -year-old from the UK shared a list of some of the regular questions sheaposs asked by shoppers on a daily basis on her TikTok account, @kelceyatkinsonx, and many other supermarket employees could relate.She began: Things I, an Aldi worker, hate hearing. She started off by saying that one of the things that annoy her the most is being told to scan slower - and unsurprisingly, this happens very often. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Then she says sheaposs regularly asked why the food is so cheap. Other questions she gets, included: Have you got it round the back  and can I speak to your manager  Kelcey also gets frustrated when sheaposs asked whether she gets a discount, when items will be back in stock and whether something can be put aside for a later date.Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and dozens of comments from people who were keen to share their thoughts. One person said: Donapost forget aposcan you scan the bags firstapos when the bags are at the end of their shopping. Another wrote: I work in Lidl and hear the exact same things. title: cleaning fan shares diy miracle
story: Cleaning fan shares DIY miracle spray that keeps dust away for weeksA woman has gone viral on TikTok for sharing a recipe for her "miracle" DIY dust eliminating spray in a video that has been viewed for than two million times by thankful viewersIts completely natural and smells incredible Image: tiktok @whitneykailynByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsDusting is one of those chores that feels like itaposs never-ending. It seems like as soon as you finished the job, a thin veil of dust appears on everything youaposve just cleaned. Thankfully, one woman has revealed how to eliminate it once and for all.Whitney White often shares DIY tutorials on her TikTok account @whitneykailyn , from laundry soap to glass cleaning, where she has , followers.She shared the recipe for her dust aposeliminatingapos spray in a video thataposs since gone viral, being viewed more than . million times. The clip is captioned: The BEST DIY dusting spray to polish and eliminate dust longer.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. To make the spray, Whitney combines one cup of water, a quarter of a cup of white vinegar, two tablespoons of olive oil and  to  drops of lemon essential oil. She then sprays it onto any surface and buffs in using a cloth - and she swears she doesnapost have to dust again for another two weeks. The oils polish and keep dust away for longer periods of time, she promises. And whataposs better is that itaposs completely natural and it makes your home smell incredible. Since being posted, the video has been liked almost , times and has received  comments from people who praised how well it worked.One person said: I was hesitant about this solution really working but I gave it a chance and holy cr*p... itaposs a miracle solution. You should patent his lol. Another wrote: Tried this... It works so good. I hardly saw any dust after a week. A third commented: Never tried with olive oil but now I am going to! Someone  put: I need to try this. I feel like I have to dust every day. Others were surprised by the olive oil element, writing: You stopped me at olive oil. Really  What a great idea.Whitney reassured those wonderingthe olive oil would leave an oily residue, saying: Notyou only use a little bit, and you can use a slightly damp rag too to offset the oily substance. Some viewers were concerned that the olive oil would go rancid, but Whitney said: Olive oil combined with vinegar is good for  to  months. She also said that any citrus oil would work in place of the lemon one she used.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: inside impressive six bed house
story: Inside impressive six-bed house with its own dog spa, barn and goat creameryThis -acre property in New York, US, has gone up for sale for £. million - with five bedrooms, six bathrooms, a goat creamery, a dog spa and even its own barn for horsesIts a pet-owners dream Image: Jam Press Greg Glazer PhotographByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsHousehunting can be dficult when youaposve got pets to consider. Generally speaking, the boxes your prospective new home needs to tick for you and your family might include good transport links, shops nearby and a high standard of teaching at local schools. But knowing what to look for to cater for your pet’s needs, safety and happiness can be a little harder to decipher. Well, look no further as this -room house has catered for dogs, goats and horses. The property, located in New York, US, spans across  acres, boasts five bedrooms and six bathrooms and has hit the market for . million . For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. But the stand-out is the propertyaposs designated grooming rooms for pet dogs, where the woofers can be pampered with bathing, drying, brushing, nail trimming and ear cleaning. And it doesnapost stop at the pampered pooches when it comes to rooms dedicated to four-legged friends. You can also make your own goataposs cheese at the propertyaposs Goat Creamery and keep horses in their own barn. Andyouaposre tired of caring for animals, the homeowner is offered the chance to dab in a bit of self-care with their own home theatre, sauna and world-class professional gym. Exposed beams and brick walls, cathedral ceilings and sliding glass doors inside the property add character and decadence. Running with the theme, the kitchen is spacious complete with its own breakfast bar with marble flooring and wooden interior. Outside thereaposs a spa, a hot tub, gazebos and balconies looking over the acres of trees, helping to mimic a quiet retreat – taking you worldaposs away from one of the busiest cities in the world. The homeowner will also be greeted with two garages, a chicken coop, greenhouses, sheds and two garages when mooching around in the back garden.  Gated and with video surveillance, the property offers complete privacy while at the same time being just a short drive away from shopping. The property is listed for .Mwith Four Seasons Sotheby’s International.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it.
